verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses on Mount Sinai, saying,
verses.comment: Keeps the phrase 'on Mount Sinai' as in Hebrew.

verses.text: Speak to the people of Israel and say to them, When you come into the land that I give you, the land must keep a sabbath to the LORD.
verses.comment: 'Sabbath to the LORD' retains the original phrasing.

verses.text: For six years you shall sow your fields, and for six years you shall prune your vineyards and gather in their crops.
verses.comment: Literal rendering; 'gather in their crops' as per Hebrew.

verses.text: But in the seventh year there shall be a sabbath of solemn rest for the land, a sabbath to the LORD. You shall not sow your field or prune your vineyard.
verses.comment: 'Sabbath of solemn rest' follows literal sense.

verses.text: You shall not reap what grows by itself of your harvest, or gather the grapes of your untended vine. It shall be a year of rest for the land.
verses.comment: 'Untended vine' (nazir) – reflects original meaning.

verses.text: The sabbath produce of the land shall be food for you, for your male and female servants, and for your hired worker and sojourner who lives with you,
verses.comment: Maintains terms 'sojourner' and 'hired worker'.

verses.text: and for your cattle and the wild animals that are in your land: all its produce shall be for food.
verses.comment: 'Wild animals' (behemah); kept original meaning.

verses.text: You shall count seven sabbaths of years for yourself—seven times seven years—so that the duration of the seven sabbaths of years will be forty-nine years for you.
verses.comment: Literal rendering of 'sabbaths of years'.

verses.text: Then you shall sound the trumpet loudly on the tenth day of the seventh month. On the Day of Atonement you shall sound the trumpet throughout all your land.
verses.comment: 'Day of Atonement' as in context; 'trumpet' (shofar) literal.

verses.text: You shall make the fiftieth year holy and proclaim liberty throughout the land to all its inhabitants. It shall be a jubilee for you, and each of you shall return to his own property, and each of you shall return to his own clan.
verses.comment: 'Jubilee' follows Hebrew yovel; 'liberty' literal.

verses.text: That fiftieth year shall be a jubilee for you. In it you shall neither sow nor reap what grows of itself nor gather from the undressed vines.
verses.comment: 'Undressed vines' matches Hebrew.

verses.text: For it is a jubilee; it shall be holy to you. You shall eat its produce straight from the field.
verses.comment: 'Produce straight from the field' is literal and clear.

verses.text: In this Year of Jubilee each of you shall return to his own property.
verses.comment: Repeats earlier command for emphasis.

verses.text: If you make a sale to your neighbor or buy from your neighbor, you shall not wrong one another.
verses.comment: Two-way guidance for selling and buying. 'Wrong' = oppress or defraud.

verses.text: You shall buy from your neighbor according to the number of years since the Jubilee, and he shall sell to you according to the number of years of crops.
verses.comment: Land value tied to years remaining until Jubilee.

verses.text: If the years are many, you shall increase the price, and if few, you shall reduce the price, because he is selling you a number of harvests.
verses.comment: 'Number of harvests' literal from Hebrew.

verses.text: You shall not wrong one another, but you shall fear your God; for I am the LORD your God.
verses.comment: Fear includes acting justly in this context.

verses.text: Therefore you shall do my statutes and keep my regulations and do them; and you will dwell safely in the land.
verses.comment: Statutes/regulations are literal and differentiate between types of law.

verses.text: The land will yield its fruit, and you will eat your fill and dwell securely in it.
verses.comment: Phrase 'eat your fill' as in Hebrew idiom.

verses.text: If you say, 'What shall we eat in the seventh year? Behold, we shall not sow or gather in our produce!'
verses.comment: Direct speech, true to rhetorical structure.

verses.text: I will command my blessing on you in the sixth year, so that it will bring forth produce enough for three years.
verses.comment: Emphasizes supernatural provision.

verses.text: You shall sow in the eighth year, and eat old produce until the ninth year; until its produce comes in, you shall eat the old.
verses.comment: Chronology kept literal to meaning—sabbath/parallels to other 'rest' texts.

verses.text: The land shall not be sold permanently, for the land is mine; you are strangers and sojourners with me.
verses.comment: Phrase 'strangers and sojourners' kept literal.

verses.text: In all the land of your possession, you shall allow the redemption of the land.
verses.comment: 'Redemption' (Geulah) is technical and literal.

verses.text: If your brother becomes poor and sells some of his property, then his nearest redeemer shall come and redeem what his brother sold.
verses.comment: Law of kinsman-redeemer; kept specific.

verses.text: If a man has no one to redeem it but he himself becomes able and finds the means to redeem it,
verses.comment: 'Finds the means' is idiomatic for Hebrew phrase.

verses.text: then let him count the years since he sold it and restore the balance to the man to whom he sold it. Then he shall return to his property.
verses.comment: Redemption calculation literal from Hebrew.

verses.text: But if he is not able to get it back for himself, then what he sold shall stay in the hand of the buyer until the Year of Jubilee. In the Jubilee it shall be released, and he shall return to his property.
verses.comment: 'Released' (shuv) – the restoration is literal.

verses.text: If a man sells a dwelling house in a walled city, he may redeem it within a year from its sale; for a full year he shall have the right of redemption.
verses.comment: 'Walled city' distinction from rural property.

verses.text: If it is not redeemed within a full year, then the house that is in the walled city shall pass permanently to the buyer, through his generations; it shall not be released in the Jubilee.
verses.comment: Distinction for urban property is kept.

verses.text: But the houses of villages that have no wall around them shall be considered as the fields of the land; they may be redeemed, and they shall be released in the Jubilee.
verses.comment: Literal to original legal distinctions.

verses.text: Nevertheless, the cities of the Levites, that is, the houses in the cities of their possession, the Levites may redeem at any time.
verses.comment: 'At any time' preserves perpetual right for Levites.

verses.text: If someone purchases from the Levites, the house that was sold in the city of their possession shall be released in the Jubilee, for the houses of the cities of the Levites are their possession among the children of Israel.
verses.comment: Levite property has a restoration guarantee.

verses.text: But the fields of pastureland belonging to their cities may not be sold, for they are a perpetual possession.
verses.comment: 'Perpetual' (olam) is a legal term for lasting ownership.

verses.text: If your brother becomes poor and cannot maintain himself with you, you shall help him as you would a stranger or a sojourner, that he may live with you.
verses.comment: 'Help' literal for Hebrew chazaq.

verses.text: Take no interest or profit from him, but fear your God, that your brother may live with you.
verses.comment: 'Interest or profit' matches technical Hebrew terms.

verses.text: You shall not lend him your money at interest, nor give him your food for profit.
verses.comment: Financial terms left literal.

verses.text: I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt to give you the land of Canaan and to be your God.
verses.comment: Divine introduction formula.

verses.text: If your brother with you becomes poor and sells himself to you, you shall not make him serve as a slave.
verses.comment: 'Servant' distinction over slave is retained.

verses.text: He shall be with you as a hired worker and as a sojourner; he shall serve with you until the Year of Jubilee.
verses.comment: Jubilee as terminus of debt service.

verses.text: Then he shall depart from you, he and his children with him, and shall return to his own family and return to the property of his fathers.
verses.comment: Restoration to ancestral land is retained.

verses.text: For they are my servants, whom I brought out of the land of Egypt; they shall not be sold as slaves.
verses.comment: Israel belongs to God; cannot be permanent slaves.

verses.text: You shall not rule over him with harshness, but you shall fear your God.
verses.comment: 'Harshness' (perek) is an exact rendering.

verses.text: As for your male and female slaves whom you may have—from the nations around you, from them you may buy male and female slaves.
verses.comment: Non-Israelite slaves explicitly allowed as in Hebrew.

verses.text: You may also buy from the children of the sojourners who live among you, and from their families who are with you, whom they have fathered in your land; and they shall become your property.
verses.comment: 'Property' (achuzah) just as in original.

verses.text: You may bequeath them to your children after you, to inherit as a possession forever. In them you may make others serve. But over your brothers, the people of Israel, you shall not rule, one over another, with harshness.
verses.comment: 'Forever' (olam); 'harshness' same as v.43.

verses.text: If a sojourner or stranger with you becomes rich and your brother among you becomes poor and sells himself to the sojourner who is with you, or to a member of the stranger's family,
verses.comment: 'Sojourner' and 'stranger' distinction preserved.

verses.text: after he has sold himself, he may be redeemed. One of his brothers may redeem him,
verses.comment: Emphasizes right of kin to redeem.

verses.text: or his uncle or his uncle's son may redeem him, or any of his blood relatives from his family may redeem him. Or if he becomes able, he may redeem himself.
verses.comment: 'Blood relatives' literal; self-redemption is explicit.

verses.text: He shall calculate with his buyer from the year that he sold himself to him until the Year of Jubilee, and the price of his sale shall be according to the number of years. They shall reckon with him as a hired worker.
verses.comment: Exact calculation, based on wage analogy.

verses.text: If there are still many years, according to them he shall pay back the redemption price from the money he was bought for.
verses.comment: 'Redemption price' literal economic phrase.

verses.text: If there remain but a few years until the Year of Jubilee, he shall calculate with him, and he shall pay his redemption out of the years.
verses.comment: Pro-rated redemption for short terms.

verses.text: As a worker hired year by year he shall be with him; he shall not rule over him with harshness in your sight.
verses.comment: Harsh treatment forbidden for Israelite brothers.

verses.text: If he is not redeemed by these means, then he and his children with him shall go free in the Year of Jubilee.
verses.comment: 'Go free' is a technical phrase for manumission.

verses.text: For to me the people of Israel are servants; they are my servants whom I brought out of the land of Egypt. I am the LORD your God.
verses.comment: Section ends with covenant formula and Divine ownership.
